member.name: T:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Interfaces.IJobManagerApi
member.summary: Defines the contract for the Job Management API. These methods correspond to the REST/gRPC endpoints for managing jobs.

member.name: T:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Interfaces.IJobManagerInternalApi
member.summary: Defines the contract for the internal control plane APIs, typically used for communication between JobManager and TaskManagers (e.g., via gRPC).

member.summary: TaskManager reports completion of its state persistence for a checkpoint.

member.summary: JobManager requests a TaskManager to initiate a checkpoint. (Note: In Flink, barriers are injected into streams. This might be an alternative or complementary control path)

member.name: M:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Interfaces.IJobManagerInternalApi.RequestRecovery(FlinkDotNet.JobManager.InternalApiModels.RequestRecoveryRequest)
member.summary: JobManager requests a TaskManager (or a new instance) to recover state for a job.

member.name: M:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Interfaces.IJobManagerInternalApi.Heartbeat(FlinkDotNet.JobManager.InternalApiModels.HeartbeatRequest)
member.summary: TaskManager sends a heartbeat to the JobManager.

member.name: T:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.JobGraph.KeyingInfo
member.summary: Contains information about how the output of a specific JobEdge is keyed. This is a refined version of OutputKeyingConfig, potentially specific to an edge if needed, or can be a direct reference if KeyingInfo and OutputKeyingConfig are identical. For now, let's assume it mirrors OutputKeyingConfig for simplicity in JobVertex.OutputEdgeKeying.

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OperatorDefinitionDto.Name
member.summary: Unique name for this operator step, used for defining connections.

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OperatorDefinitionDto.TypeName
member.summary: Assembly-qualified class name of the user-defined function (e.g., ISourceFunction, IMapOperator, IFlatMapOperator, ISinkFunction, IReduceOperator, etc.).

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OperatorDefinitionDto.OperatorType
member.summary: Type of the operator, e.g., "Source", "Operator", "Sink". Used by JobManager to determine VertexType and apply appropriate logic.

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OperatorDefinitionDto.Inputs
member.summary: Names of upstream operators this operator consumes from. For a source, this list would be empty or null.

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OperatorDefinitionDto.InputDataTypes
member.summary: Assembly-qualified name(s) of the input data type(s) for this operator. If multiple inputs, this list should correspond to the order in 'Inputs'. For the head of a chain, this is the external input type. For chained operators, this is the output type of the previous operator in the chain.

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OperatorDefinitionDto.OutputType
member.summary: Assembly-qualified name of the output data type of this operator. For a chain, this is the output type of the *last* operator in the chain. For a sink, this might be null or the type it consumes.

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OperatorDefinitionDto.InputSerializerTypeName
member.summary: Optional: Assembly-qualified type name of the ITypeSerializer for this operator's primary input. Applies to the head operator of a chain.

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OperatorDefinitionDto.OutputSerializerTypeName
member.summary: Optional: Assembly-qualified type name of the ITypeSerializer for this operator's primary output. Applies to the output of the last operator in a chain.

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OperatorDefinitionDto.OutputKeying
member.summary: Optional: Configuration for keying the output of this operator (or the last operator in its chain).

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OperatorDefinitionDto.ChainedOperators
member.summary: Optional: A list of subsequent operator definitions to be chained to this operator. The 'Inputs' and 'Parallelism' of these chained DTOs are ignored.

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OperatorDefinitionDto.Windowing
member.summary: Optional: Windowing configuration if this operator is a windowed computation.

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OperatorDefinitionDto.OperatorPropertiesJson
member.summary: Generic properties for operator configuration, serialized as JSON string. Specific operators can deserialize this to their own config objects. Example: file path for a FileSource, or UDF constructor parameters.

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OutputKeyingConfigDto.SerializedKeySelector
member.summary: String representation of the key selector logic. Examples: "prop:OrderId", "field:customerCategory", "type:MyProject.MyKeySelector, MyAssembly" This string will be parsed by the TaskManager to activate the key selection.

member.name: P:FlinkDotNet.JobManager.Models.OutputKeyingConfigDto.KeyTypeName
member.summary: Assembly-qualified name of the key's data type. Example: "System.String", "System.Int32", "MyProject.Types.OrderKey, MyAssembly"

member.name: M:FlinkDotNet.Proto.Internal.JobManagerInternalService.JobManagerInternalServiceBase.Heartbeat(FlinkDotNet.Proto.Internal.JobManagerHeartbeatRequest,Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext)
member.summary: Heartbeat was part of this service in one version, but seems to be part of TaskManagerRegistration in another. Let's assume TaskManagerRegistration.SendHeartbeat is the one to keep, and JobManagerInternalService.Heartbeat might be deprecated or for a different purpose. For this merge, I will OMIT JobManagerInternalService.Heartbeat if TaskManagerRegistration.SendHeartbeat exists and is more complete. The provided diff for JobManagerController uses TaskManagerTracker, which is updated by TaskManagerRegistrationService.
member.param: The request received from the client.
The context of the server-side call handler being invoked.
member.returns: The response to send back to the client (wrapped by a task).

member.summary: Heartbeat was part of this service in one version, but seems to be part of TaskManagerRegistration in another. Let's assume TaskManagerRegistration.SendHeartbeat is the one to keep, and JobManagerInternalService.Heartbeat might be deprecated or for a different purpose. For this merge, I will OMIT JobManagerInternalService.Heartbeat if TaskManagerRegistration.SendHeartbeat exists and is more complete. The provided diff for JobManagerController uses TaskManagerTracker, which is updated by TaskManagerRegistrationService.
member.param: The request to send to the server.
The initial metadata to send with the call. This parameter is optional.
An optional deadline for the call. The call will be cancelled if deadline is hit.
An optional token for canceling the call.
member.returns: The response received from the server.
